stimulusHtml:
A researcher wants to examine the effect of 2 different strengths—low and high—of fertilizer on the growth of corn. A field will be divided into 54 equally sized plots of land, and the 2 fertilizer strengths will be randomly assigned so that 27 plots will be fertilized with low strength and 27 plots with high strength. The same type and amount of corn will be planted in each plot at the same time. The yield (amount of corn produced) will be measured for each plot.

Which of the following would provide the best evidence that the strength of fertilizer had an effect on the yield?
choicesHtml: The variation in yields within the fertilizer strength groups is greater than the variation in the average yields between the fertilizer strength groups.
The variation in yields within the fertilizer strength groups is less than the variation in the average yields between the fertilizer strength groups.
The variation in yields is about the same for all plots.
The variation in yields of plots receiving the low-strength fertilizer is greater than the variation in yields of plots receiving the high-strength fertilizer.
The variation in yields of plots receiving the low-strength fertilizer is less than the variation in yields of plots receiving the high-strength fertilizer.
